intro: Schizoloma lobatum var. malabaricum, commonly known as the Malabar thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by spherical, yellowish fruits. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a serrated or lobed margin. The plant is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
